review: We had passion fruit sodas, and two authentic curries. The best meal we had in Sri Lanka! Not only was it affordable, it was authentic, and recommended by a number of Locals!

Probably best all around Sri Lankan cuisine. We had the fried rice, spicy curry, house rice and curry, and potato curry. All very tasty. Short wait time and very attentive staff. Very welcoming atmosphere. Owner is very friendly. Back to the food‚Ä¶the sweet stuff is...standout here! From the papaya lassi to the banana coconut chocolate pancake with vanilla ice cream and coconut sprinkle, YES! Wow. Simply amazing. Great way to finish a post surf session feast. I would come back for everything, but I would leave whatever restaurant you‚Äôre eating at to have dessert he standout here! From the papaya lassi to the banana coconut chocolate pancake with vanilla ice cream and coconut sprinkle, YES! Wow. Simply amazing. Great way to finish a post surf session feast. I would come back for everything, but I would leave whatever restaurant you‚Äôre eating at to have dessert here.

We went to this restaurant after reading positive reviews. Must say the food was very disappointing both dishes we ordered the prawns and chicken were overcooked. When I asked the staff they said it was normal for the food to be like that which I...completely disagree with. How can dry overcooked chicken that is hard to swallow be norm completely disagree with. How can dry overcooked chicken that is hard to swallow be normal!

Me and my mango friends went to the place that we found on trip advisor. We odered prowns plates and rice (Include pappodoms and coconut sambol). It was very delicious with nice precentation. Genuine Srilankan Foods generous portions. Thnak You MEEWITHAüôè

Came to  Meewitha from the reviews on TripAdvisor and bet you it's exactly what they say.
Little family kitchen holding a max of 16 people, expect 20 to 25 min wait for  your food since it's freshly prepared.
And onve served just enjoy every bit...of glamour.
The spices are so good, and the portions are generous. Definitely coming back for every meal while in Waliga of glamour.
The spices are so good, and the portions are generous. Definitely coming back for every meal while in Waligama.

I have been in Sri Lanka for 5 months, but this restaurant has the best rice and curry ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è. After reading reviews and going there, it becomes our best restaurant in weligama.
 I highly recommend it.

Good place to try some local dishes made by a Sri Lankan family and served with a sweet smile while reading a big poster touting the health benefits of curry leaves. It's right on the main road in town, so it's noisy and not the...most romantic place. Also, there is no AC. Only fa most romantic place. Also, there is no AC. Only fans.
Best place on Sri Lanka for eating rice and curry ,noodles,fried rice with diferent option: nice prawns,chicken vegano option. Thanks you‚ù§Ô∏èüíñ

My friends and I went out for a meal almost every night, prawns and squid, sauce, just amazing. Fast service, friendly atmosphere, always lots of people. The best fruit cocktails. Very friendly prices for tourists. Greetings from Latvia with love.
I am Vegan. The best vegetarian curry I had on our  2 week trip through Sri Lanka. Went there for lunch. Awesome currys, great price and friedly services. Thanks üôè

Best Rice Curry and Smoothies in Weligama. I have been three times this restaurant. Year by year. Always was so Good. Also friendly helpful staff was nice. Thank you so much for lovely experience. Good luck
I tried a lot of different rice and curries in Weligama and this place had the best. The staff is friendly and the desert was good too.
Best food quality for price. Amazing local tastes made with love. Their kitchen really know what they do! I believe this is top for local food you can find in Weligama.
We ordered the five person curry rice and it was a wonderful mix of flavors -- both the main seafood dishes and all the vegetable dishes. Each one was delicious on its own and even better together.

I discovered Meewitha in 2015 by pure chance. I tried it and I loved it. Year after year this place got better and faster in delivering the superb srilankan food you can find here. It‚Äôs genuine, super tasty and very good priced. The family running...it is lovely (they recognised me after more than two years I was not coming due to covid!). If you want to eat Srilankan original food, come here. Best place in Weliga it is lovely (they recognised me after more than two years I was not coming due to covid!). If you want to eat Srilankan original food, come here. Best place in Weligama.
This restaurant is a very cool place, the food here is delicious :) It was a pleasure to be served by Sanju - he helped me to figure out how to eat a local cuisine :)
Sanju great! Eat great! Thx! We try fish carry, mango was so hot, be careful. Tuna salad something awesome. Will back this place

The seared tuna is delicious ! Prawn burger, calamari and seafood soup equally tasty 

Thanks to Malith for welcoming us with a huge smile and giving us great menu recommendations

Great atmosphere, tasty food and mocktails. The staff was realy welcoming, especially Alith! He checked in with us through our time here, asked if everything was good or we need something more. We asked for beer and he went to get that for us from...bar across - nice experien bar across - nice experience!

Delicious Fish & Chips! 
Very friendly service and a good place to chill. 
Will be visiting more throughout my stay in Sri Lanka!
We had an amazing lunch at sea salt society. The island prawns and prawn salad were both delicious , and our waiter Malith was incredible. Thank you for a great lunch!

Good food and friendly service. Sanju was great. We got the seafood platter and tuna tataki to start. Tataki was not too bad, the platter was quite good. It is on the expensive side for sure, compared to other places around.
Werry nice staff, we serie served by Malith and he answered all our questions about the food. We ordered vegetarian curry. It was good.

Have been several time from Marriot! Very good place! Carry crab and carry prawns are delicious!
Malith waiter was polite and kind!
The food was really good and didn‚Äòt take long. The service was also amazing and the location is also really nice! Thanks Sanju!
Thank you Santu, you are very kind and helpful. The food and coffee is delicious. We have fish. See you Katerina and Michael
Great food.  Nice seafood curries. Location excellent. Malith, our waiter, was very friendly and helpful. He checked how spicy we wanted our curries. Great experience.

We had a really great meal here - had the catch of the day and the fish curry. Fish curry was one of the best curries I‚Äôve had. Really nice vibes and service. Big shout out to Malith who served us and was really lovely!

We ordered fish catch of the day and chicken cashew. Delicious! (In fact so delicious that I ordered 2 portions of the cashew chicken).
Malith our waiter very friendly and helpful and so were the other guys.
And good music to go with the food.
Really nice place to have fresh seafood after a long beach day. Malith, the waiter was very kind and friendly. Would absolutely recommend the catch of the day!

We had a great meal tonight snd were so pleased to be able to finally eat here, after walking past on a few occasions snd noticing how busy it always is, a good sign in our opinion.  I had hoppers and my husband rice and...we shared six wonderful dishes to accompany them. The food was plentiful, tasty very enjoyable and excellent value for money, but  we sadly could not manage to finish everything. We would highly recommend anyone to visit this place ar least once when staying in Weliga we shared six wonderful dishes to accompany them. The food was plentiful, tasty very enjoyable and excellent value for money, but  we sadly could not manage to finish everything. We would highly recommend anyone to visit this place ar least once when staying in Weligama.

Really great food at very reasonable price. Great for vegetarians and will alter dishes to suit taste regarding heat.
Veg curry had five small potions of different dishes. All washed down with cold beer. Can‚Äôt wait to go back again.

Went to dine in Dulnetha few times during my stay at Weligama. Undoubtedly, the food/beverage was amazing and if you are looking for traditional/local Sri Lankan flavors, best place to indulge

The atmosphere was inviting, cozy and yet with elegant interiors. 

Loved the hospitality of...this place, was very homely and warm. Lastly, a huge applaud/thanks to the entire team/friends for their great effort and servi this place, was very homely and warm. Lastly, a huge applaud/thanks to the entire team/friends for their great effort and service!
Such a beautiful restaurant and beautiful family. Food was some of the best I‚Äôve ever on my trip. Very cheap too!
We can by recommendation and super enjoyed the food at the restaurant. Everything was super tasty- we took vegetarian hoppers and veggie noodles which were delicious.
Amazing food and service! We were blown away by the meal we had at this restaurant. It was authentic Sri Lankan food. They were so reasonably priced and worth every cent. We definitely be back!
Awesome authentic sri Lankan food. Highly recommend checking the spot out. Really nice fresh juices & great dinner dishes
Visited here 3-4 times. First visit was not good experience, food was bit tasteless. But the rest times everything was just great annd tasty. Good service too! Price/quality is very good!

Excellent food. We had breakfast and dinner here, the portions were huge and very tasty.

Friendly service and a nice atmosphere.
Amazing curry and staff! If you are in Weligama you should definetly go here. Big portions and so delicious. Loooooooooved the mango chutney.
Delicious food ! Highly recommend. Staff are so friendly and kind, great vibe ! And the food has a wonderful seasoning

A lovely family restaurant. Parents cooking in kitchn . Daughter serving. She was very polite and Sri Lankan food was lovely. Asked if we wanted spicy or not. My husband had fish curry which came with about five other sides including jackfruit, beetroot, popadoms.

The food was beautiful here. We were looking for traditional Sri Lankan home made food and it‚Äôs exactly what we got. The price was so incredibly good so we decided to order a few dishes to try. We both tried the curry, chicken and fish...and coconut roti and egg roti. The fish was too strong for me so if you don‚Äôt like too strong fish taste in the sauce don‚Äôt pour it all over. The fish itself was fresh and tasty. 

The meal came with 5 sides and poppadoms. What a treat! So much food, so much taste and from a family restaurant with home recipes. The family snd staff who run it are also very lovely.

We came here for dinner and the food was as absolutely delicious. You must try the Kottu‚Ä¶ SO tasty ! Also, amazing staff - very friendly and  cozy setting. Would definitely come back!
The food was amazing, the atmosphere was also nice and the people very friendly! We will come back :) thank you

This is my favorite place in Weligama. My dad and I have been coming every day for breakfast/brunch while we are in Weligama. I crave the smoothie bowls--each one of them is delicious. They are full of fresh fruit and delicious granola. We have had...the other dishes on the menu as well and each one is fabulous. What has really made the place special is one of the staff members, Sathya. Sathya makes sure our order is exactly as we it to be. After we came once, he remembered exactly the specifics of what we liked. Sathya is an excellent communicator and he is an incredibly warm person. He makes us feel welcome as soon as we enter. The place was packed and yet the service was super quick and efficient. I enjoyed my fresh juice, panini and coffee.

Super nice staff, excellent food and drinks. Bit loud due busy road crossing right next to. I was too big fella for the furniture, couldn‚Äôt fit my legs ubder the table, had to sit sideways to the table.
Fast service and very good food. We had avocado toast and benedicte roesti, both were delicious! thanks !

The staff make this place. They‚Äôre all awesome, really attentive, easy going and professional. 

I am obsessed with the icey soul, with added home made almond milk. It‚Äôs an all time fave. The smoothie bowls are the best I have ever had.

The poke bowls...are equally great. 

Definitely worth the visit. I couldn‚Äôt stay away. It‚Äôs as good today as it was a few years back! 

Genuinely I‚Äôd go to bed excited for brekkie he are equally great.

What an amazing find for us while staying at the Marriott Weligama!

Nomad is short walk from the Marriott Hotel, and my kids and I ate there every day. It's a small outdoor seated cafe, with a lovely vibe and cheerful team. 

Their coffee, drinks,...Tuna Poke Bowl and Granola Fruit bowl with passion fruit were all delicious. 

Nomad is clearly a thoroughly professionally run business and it shows in the way the staff and food is presented. 

Nomad is always busy with guests - a true sign of a good business. 

I recommend it highly!

A must go when in Weligama.

I would like to express my gratitude to the staff of Nomad Cafe for the amazing atmosphere, delicious food, and prompt service. The cafe staff also helped me prepare a surprise for my husband (special thanks to Krishan) - they custom-made a cake and celebrated...my husband's special occasion. Thank you for your flexibility and personalized approa my husband's special occasion. Thank you for your flexibility and personalized approach.

Best smoothie bowl around- and I've tried a few!! 
Fresh delicious food and truly wonderful service!

My husband and I visited Nomad for a late lunch. We ordered 2 dishes to share and coffee. The coffee was very good but the raw tuna in the tuna bowl was clearly not fresh and looked quite grey, also there were chewy parts as...the tuna was not cut  right. My appetite was gone, but my husband still ate it as he was very hungry. I still decided to mention it to the waiters as they better prevent happening this in the future. We showed the tuna, but they denied there was a problem. They ignored the problem fully and did not even apologise. I think Nomad is not aware of the fact that old raw tuna can make you sick (next tot that it is  very unpleasant to eat). I normally don‚Äôt like to complain about a place with a review, but as the waiters did not respond to the problem at all I don‚Äôt see an other opti the tuna was not cut  right. I went to eat the day before yesterday..the food was very delicious but the unpleasant thing was a sweaty waiter served me.I am surprised that the order was delayed and he gave me carrot cake which I did not order.
He should be more concerned...about the hygiene and smell of the waiter wearing long denim pants fit muscle g about the hygiene and smell of the waiter wearing long denim pants fit muscle guy.
One of my favourite cafe in Weligama. The food is fresh and delicious, you can even take away. I was very happy to finally drink a really good coffee in SL !

Good food.  Great coffee.  There is a beach bum/backpacker/self-conscious traveler vibe that this place is clearly aiming at.  And I think they hit it.  It‚Äôs not a spontaneous authentic gem or anything, but they are good at what they‚Äôre trying to do.  Music is (or...at least was for us) a bit too loud to conver at least was for us) a bit too loud to converse.
I can't believe how great this place is! The food is absolutly amazing, and the vegan options are plenty. Really, highly recommend. It's a little pricy but worth it.
